Ask HN: What are the most important challenges?
text:
Say you had no need to make a living - imagine you win the lottery or something like that. You don't get to have millions but you don't _need_ to work.

Now imagine that you still _want_ to work but now you can select to work on whatever you want.

Lastly, say that you would want to maximize your impact on helping solving most pressing problems for humanity now.

What would it be? What would you work on? Just curious to see what strikes as a priority.

Show HN: Spotify2PDF-Save Spotify Playlist to PDF File
text:
A smart Spotify Playlist PDF converter, one click to export Spotify Playlist or Track  to PDF, archive Spotify Playlist  as PDF.
If you want to print your Spotify Playlist to photos, you can use Spotify2PDF to quickly generate pdf files in A4 or A5.

title: New 13th-gen Intel Core desktop CPUs are handing out cores to everyone
Show HN: Semantic Search for Any Video
text:
Hello HN

Over the New Year's break, I created semanticvideosearch.com. This can search any video based on meaning and context. I would love to get your feedback on it. What should I change and what can be improved?

The preprocessed videos can be search very quickly, while the youtube video links take some time (yt videos also have a upper duration limit due to compute issues). I intend to add search based on the frames of the video soon.

I would love to know your thoughts on the demo and any suggestions for improvements.

Thanks!

PS: the inspiration to create this was to get the 2 mins of content from youtube videos with 18 other mins of fluff.

title: Ask HN: List of blogs maintained with love by independent website owners?
text:
Is there a search engine or a directory page where I can find a list of blogs maintained by independent website owners?

I am increasingly finding that I don't want to read stuff that are on mass-blogging platforms like Medium, Substack, and the likes. They occasionally contain good blogs but the vast majority has poor quality content. And they all look the same. They all have the same layout, same fonts, same dark patterns of the platform affecting the reading experience of every blog. They all seem to be after likes or claps or followers or whatever the cool thing for internet points is these days.

I like reading blogs where the authors maintain their websites with love with none of the shenanigans of mass-blogging platforms. Where can I get a list of them? Where can I search for them?

title: Ask HN: Can mindfulness be maintained when lost in thought?
text:
Ok... so a bit off topic here. Recently I have found great reward in keeping with the moment as much as possible [1]. Simply watching what arises in my experience as low-level as possible.

In reality, I briefly watch the mind as it thinks, then I, the observer get swept up into the thought itself.

I pop out the other side after seconds, minutes, hours, days. I am self aware again.

My question is, where is it that I go during this process? Can observation take place there? Should one avoid this state (with effort), or accept its coming and going?

State A is watching whatever arises, including myself.

State B is forgetting that there is even one to watch.

What is the relationship between these states?

[1] - Waking Up app - of late James Low)
